title: 'Deception & farce': Hasina rejects B'desh poll results, calls it 'disgraceful chapter'
content: Former Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina, living in exile, has branded the recent February 12 polls a 'pre-planned election of deception and farce.' She alleges widespread manipulation and unrealistic turnout figures. Meanwhile, her rival Khaleda Zia's party, the BNP, secured a significant victory, prompting calls for Hasina's extradition from India to face trial.

title: CM Omar gets rare praise from BJP MLAs for Amarnath Yatra fund allocation
content: BJP MLAs lauded Chief Minister Omar Abdullah's Rs 180 crore budget for the Amarnath Yatra, seeing it as a positive sign of Kashmir joining the national mainstream. Despite party criticism on other issues, legislators acknowledged this constructive decision, highlighting a perceived shift in the CM's stance on the pilgrimage, a move they felt deserved appreciation.

title: After Ford lost nearly $5 billion, CEO Jim Farley says: We got the message that ...
content: Ford's electric vehicle unit reported a significant $4.8 billion loss in 2025 as sales of key models declined. Facing slowing EV demand and rising hybrid interest, the automaker is pivoting to extended-range EVs and developing a lower-cost EV platform. Ford anticipates its EV business will remain unprofitable until around 2029.

title: Pitch to blame for Australia's loss to Zimbabwe? Batter gives verdict
content: "I think that's just the nature of cricket. You get a sub-continent team come to Australia and you don't get them complaining about the bounce or the pace," Renshaw said at post-match press conference

title: Happy Valentine‚Äôs Day 2026: Wishes, messages, images, status and captions
content: Valentine's Day, celebrated annually on February 14th, honours all forms of love, from romantic sparks to friendship cheers. In 2026, it falls on a Saturday, offering a perfect opportunity for connection.  Tracing its roots to ancient Roman festivals and medieval legends, the day has evolved into a global celebration of affection and appreciation.

title: Gayle-like impact? Ex-cricketer sees Abhishek Sharma as India‚Äôs T20 engine
content: "India's success in the last one year, (has) mainly depended on Abhishek Sharma, the star because the way he batted the past year, I think that's phenomenal."

title: After CEO asked employees to stop coding, Nvidia engineers get access to OpenAI's Codex
content: Nvidia has deployed OpenAI's Codex AI coding tool to all 30,000 engineers, marking a significant enterprise rollout. CEO Jensen Huang's mandate to automate tasks with AI is driving this adoption, with engineers praising the tool's ability to handle complex workflows and maintain context.

title: In a first, space PSU Nsil to distribute pvt firm GalaxEye‚Äôs satellite data
content: Bengaluru's GalaxEye has partnered with Nsil, a state-owned space company. Nsil will resell high-resolution OptoSAR data from GalaxEye's upcoming satellites. This collaboration marks the first time Nsil partners with a domestic private firm for satellite data distribution. GalaxEye's first satellite, Drishti, launches soon. The agreement covers the entire planned constellation, enabling Nsil to offer enhanced data services.

title: Cisco president Jeetu Patel says company will never hire these developers
content: Cisco's president Jeetu Patel mandates AI for all developers, aiming for half a dozen AI-coded products by 2026. This shift to spec-driven development sees human teams shrink, with AI agents tripling output. While embracing AI's potential, Cisco is investing heavily in security to prevent rogue agents, urging developers to master AI to stay relevant.

title: Drone-dropped heroin seized in J&K‚Äôs Kathua, 2 with Pakistan links held
content: Kathua Police apprehended two individuals linked to a Pakistan-based drone drug smuggling ring. Approximately 150 grams of heroin were seized from the accused, who were reportedly in contact with a Pakistani smuggler via VoIP calls. The drugs were intended for distribution among local youth. Investigations are ongoing to dismantle the entire network.

title: 254 women complained of sexual harassment at workplace under on govt‚Äôs 'SHe-Box' portal in 2025
content: The SHe-Box portal received 254 sexual harassment complaints last year, with 296 filed since its August 2024 revamp. The portal aims to streamline reporting and monitoring of the POSH Act, with 105 of the 296 complaints already disposed of. Over 1,48,700 workplaces have been onboarded, and automated notifications ensure timely complaint resolution.

title: Market crash: Investors lose Rs 9.5L cr in just two days!
content: The overall market capitalization of companies listed on the BSE shrank by Rs 7,02,017.71 crore, bringing the total valuation down to Rs 4,65,46,643.20 crore ($5.13 trillion). In the last two trading sessions investors have lost Rs 9.5 lakh crore.

title: Patrick Mahomes and Brittany Mahomes make $1M move before season
content: Patrick Mahomes, the Kansas City Chiefs‚Äô star player, is fully focused on recovering from his brutal injuries, after recording a pretty tough time on the field in the last season. As he focuses on his recovery, Patrick Mahomes and his wife, Brittany Mahomes, just pulled off a million dollar move, away from the world of NFL, which has now broken records.

title: Team Canada rules out Brad Marchand, Josh Morrissey vs Switzerland
content: Team Canada faces Switzerland at the 2026 Winter Olympics without key players Josh Morrissey and Brad Marchand. Morrissey is sidelined with an undisclosed injury sustained against Czechia, while Marchand's absence remains unexplained. Seth Jarvis is set to make his Olympic debut, replacing Morrissey on the third line, with Travis Sanheim also stepping into the lineup.

title: 'Absolutely vile': Candace Owens accuses Erika Kirk of having strange relationship with a 15-year-old girl
content: A viral post has intensified debate over Candace Owens‚Äô use of the term grooming in reference to a 15 year old. Critic Natly Denise accused Owens of exaggerating the situation, while Owens cited details from her own interview describing limited in person contact and online messages. The clash highlights ongoing tensions over how serious terms are defined and used in public commentary.

title: T20 WC: Mukkamalla, Harmeet shine as USA register first T20I win over Netherlands
content: The United States achieved a historic 93-run victory over the Netherlands in the T20 World Cup, powered by Saiteja Mukkamalla's brilliant 79 and Harmeet Singh's exceptional 4-wicket haul. Mukkamalla's stellar batting anchored USA's 196/6, while Singh's bowling dismantled the Dutch chase, restricting them to 103. This marks USA's maiden T20I win against the Netherlands.

title: Vijay Deverakonda, Rashmika Mandanna decline Rs 60 crore OTT offer for wedding video
content: Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna remain one of the most adored pairs in Tollywood. While the duo have never officially confirmed their relationship, their on-screen and off-screen chemistry has consistently kept fans invested. From Geetha Govindam to Dear Comrade, their pairing sparked admiration ‚Äî and speculation.

title: Chloe Kim‚Äôs Olympic journey revisited after silver as Garrett cheers
content: Chloe Kim missed a historic Olympic three peat in Milan Cortina, taking silver behind 17 year old Gaon Choi in the 2026 halfpipe final. Here is how the USA star's 2018 gold, 2022 repeat and 2026 silver stack up in her growing Olympic medal timeline.

title: BNP sweeps Bangladesh election: What's next for Muhammad Yunus?
content: Bangladesh's Nationalist Party has secured a decisive victory, paving the way for Tarique Rahman as prime minister. Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus, who led the interim government after a 2024 uprising, is expected to step down. His tenure focused on restoring order and implementing reforms, but the incoming government will face challenges of political polarization and foreign policy recalibration.

title: Ranveer Singh gets new threat, caller linked to Bishnoi gang warns Bollywood
content: Days after receiving an extortion threat, Ranveer Singh has now been sent another disturbing voice note ‚Äî this time from a man claiming to be associated with the Bishnoi gang. The development comes close on the heels of heightened security outside the actor‚Äôs Mumbai residence.

title: 'Not a fair fight': Rahul targets PM, calls US trade deal 'one-sided pressure' on farmers
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized the India-US trade deal, dubbing PM Modi as "Narendra Surrender Modi" and accusing him of betraying farmers. He argued the agreement creates an unfair fight for country's farmers against subsidized foreign crops. Union ministers Piyush Goyal and Shivraj Singh Chouhan refuted these claims, calling them baseless and accusing Gandhi of misleading the public.

title: 'When India re-wrote its fate': PM Modi on Seva Teerth, Kartavya Bhawans
content: ‚ÄãThe Prime Minister said the newly inaugurated buildings reflect India‚Äôs commitment to citizen-centric governance and national progress. "Today we all are witnessing a new history being made... This day of 13th February is witnessing a new beginning in India's development journey... Today, we are all entering Seva Teerth and Kartavya Bhavan with the resolve to achieve 'Viksit Bharat'. We have the divine blessings of achieving our goals," he said.

title: Donna Kelce shares sad Tom Brady photo after Jason‚Äôs Super Bowl win
content: Travis Kelce‚Äôs mother, Donna Kelce, has a never heard before way of celebrating her sons‚Äô wins, once she posted a photo of an opponent‚Äôs disappointment. Jason Kelce said it was a picture of Tom Brady who was upset after his Super Bowl LII loss. This celebration style might be coming from her longstanding banking experience, where losses seem to have a longer impact than gains.

title: India's Hasina dilemma: Resurgent BNP seeks extradition - what are New Delhi's options?
content: As Bangladesh's new government, led by the BNP, takes charge of country's affair, it has called on India for the extradition of ousted former prime minister Sheikh Hasina, who is in New Delhi. This demand presents a significant diplomatic challenge for India. Dhaka says, it seeks a relationship based on equality and mutual respect, with border security and water sharing also key issues.

title: Rohit Shetty makes first public appearance with son amid heavy security at Mumbai airport
content: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty made his first public appearance at Mumbai airport following a firing incident outside his residence. Accompanied by heavy security, he was seen bidding an emotional farewell to his son. The sighting comes after reports of gunshots near his home, leading to an ongoing investigation and increased security measures in the area.

title: 2,842 Gazans vaporised by thermobaric bombs? All about shocking weapon 'used' by Israel
content: Thousands of Palestinians have reportedly gone missing in Gaza since October 2023, with Civil Defense teams documenting at least 2,842 disappearances. Military experts suggest the use of high-temperature weapons, like thermobaric munitions, may be responsible for the extreme incineration of human tissue, leaving only biological traces.

title: B'desh polls: PM Modi dials BNP's Tarique Rahman, hails 'remarkable victory'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated Tarique Rahman on the Bangladesh Nationalist Party's decisive election victory, reaffirming India's commitment to close bilateral ties. Rahman, son of BNP founder Ziaur Rahman, is expected to become prime minister following the party's significant win, ushering in potential political stability.

title: Lakhpati Didis, farmers & start-ups: Details of first files signed by PM Modi at new office
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi signed a series of files from his new office complex, Seva Teerth. He approved a series of decisions focusing on women, youth, farmers and vulnerable citizens. According to the government, the first decisions from Seva Teerth reflect a spirit of ‚ÄúSeva‚Äù and aim to touch every section of society.

title: China sees red as CIA releases video appealing to potential PLA spies
content: The CIA's new Chinese-language recruitment video, targeting China's military, has sparked outrage in Beijing. The clip depicts a PLA officer disillusioned by corruption, a theme echoed by recent purges of top generals. China vows "all necessary measures" against foreign espionage, escalating intelligence rivalry amid US efforts to rebuild its China network.
